critique: This document is an executive order from 1945 authorizing the Petroleum Administrator to take possession of a butadiene plant due to a labor dispute that threatened the war effort. It prioritizes national security and war production. Ideologically, it's difficult to place on a left-right spectrum as it's focused on wartime necessity. Immigration is not addressed. It expands executive power during wartime. Federalism is strengthened as the federal government is taking control of a local plant. National security is prioritized over civil liberties in this specific instance. There is government intervention in the economy to ensure war production. Social inclusion is not directly addressed.
